candidates.title: Small updates
candidates.body:
- Devbox configuration for easier development
- CHANGELOG
- Update dependencies

candidates.title: Fix error with wrong storage
candidates.body:
OK, so I saved 30' because I didn't write a test to migrate from V2 to V3, and I lost 5h because I had to look for the bug...

But this also cleans up the `flbrowser` a bit by adding `async` wherever possible without passing through too many `spawn_local`s.

candidates.title: Merge pull request #99 from ineiti/add_keywords
candidates.body: Adding keywords to flnet

candidates.title: Release packages
candidates.body:
Next try at releasing useful packages.
Needed to change minor version, as this is a breaking change - things move around, some APIs change.
This release focusses on libc and wasm release.
No NPM release (yet).

But a ping-pong example app to show how to use flnet outside of flnode.

candidates.title: Complete rewrite of the code
candidates.body:
This PR rewrites most of the code. It's main goal is to:
- better separate the libc and the wasm parts
- prepare for adding libraries to crates.io and npmjs.org
- use a new `broker` system for message-passing

From the functionality, it mostly does the following:
- create a randomly connected network
- gossip chat messages instead of storing them in the root-nodes
- cleanly separate the different modules

candidates.title: Use modules
candidates.body: Changing the way modules are distributed in the system. Another cleanup will come with #88 . Instead of a big mix in the `flnode` crate, modules are now in the `flmodules` crate, and it should be easier to add new modules.

candidates.title: Adding date and showing messages as PRE
candidates.body: Closes #81

candidates.title: Storing TextMessages for every new received message
candidates.body: Closes #80

candidates.title: Add a broker
candidates.body:
This PR adds a broker to pass messages between the different Subsystems.
Because of the way wasm interacts with javascript, and the fact that there
is no threading in wasm, a broker has been deemed to be the easiest
way to communicate between the different subsystems.

Closes #73

candidates.title: This implements a simple shared chat
candidates.body:
Instead of storing all messages in a central chat server and fetching them from there,
this implements a simple shared chat server, where the messages are retrieved from
other nodes.

Closes #48

candidates.title: Adding signature and config
candidates.body: Closes #68

candidates.title: Re-implemented the UI with clean html
candidates.body:
* removed wasm/web
* moved wasm/lib to wasm-webrtc
* don't use `yew`, but a 'normal' html-file

candidates.title: Remove old nodes
candidates.body:
With a first test in the common package...

Closes #27

candidates.title: Using rust logging
candidates.body:
Uses the rust 'log' crate and then sets it up in all of
signal, web, flnode.

This is much nicer than having to pass around the logging-structure
for every new callback and structure.

Closes #23

candidates.title: Use version
candidates.body:
Adds a version string indicating the date and the commit-hash of the build.

Closes #5

candidates.title: Use caching for building rust
candidates.body:
After trying a lot of stuff with `cargo chef` and different docker-caches, the so far simplest solution is this:
- compile using rust directly in the github-action
- copy everything into the docker-images

Every combination of `cargo chef` / `dummy.rs` with `whoan/docker-build-with-cache-action` / `satackey/action-docker-layer-caching` did have some downsides.

candidates.title: Add statistics
candidates.body:
Allow the nodes to send some statistics to the signalling server.
The signalling server stores the data in the csv files and on
graphite.

candidates.title: Implementing correct handling of ICE messages
candidates.body:
Previous to this PR, only the very first ICE message has been transferred between
the initiator and the follower. This made WebRTC only work in a local network.

To send multiple ICE messages, the current structure of the libraries has been
deemed inappropriate. So all of it has been changed to use channels between
each layer of abstraction. To handle all messages, a 'process' method
in each layer of abstraction needs to be called in regular intervals.

Closes #16

candidates.title: Display nodes
candidates.body:
Close #15 
Close #17

candidates.title: Docker node
candidates.body: Add automatical builds for flnode.

candidates.title: Docker node
candidates.body:
Instead of using chrome-headless, or a chrome webrtc library, use
node to run the wasm/lib code.

This is a bit awkward, as node is missing some parts that rust-wasm
takes for granted.

Closes #10
Closes #6

candidates.title: Adding two nodes
candidates.body:
Extend cli/node to run the code from web.fledg.re
Allow setting of the configuration in web.fledg.re
Add two nodes to docker-compose.yaml

candidates.title: add local feature to avoid forgetting putting correct URL
Creating signal docker
candidates.body:
First CI/CD for
- signal - webrtc rendez-vous server
- web - simplest node in web
